missions.string: M|$testMission|$Warp 1|$We want to understand what makes objects move. In the next area, help us get moving from rest. |$Navigate your ship to an open portal.|$1|0|0|0|0|0|0|$|$|$QT\!\!Great job! I have a few pilots of my own struggling to get their ships to move - what could I tell them in order to get their ships moving?\!QR\#You have to apply a force on the ship.\#Yes, I think that works. Applying a force started them moving.\@QR\#You have to apply two opposite forces on the ship.\#Sorry, that didn't seem to work. The opposite forces canceled, and the ships did not move.\@QR\#Your ship already has to be moving.\#Sorry that didn't really help us. We want to know how to move when we're standing still.\@QR\#\#\!|QT\!\!Way to go!  What is the best general rule we could add to our flight manual for what you did?\!QR\#A object that is not moving will not start moving until acted upon by a force.\#That sounds right. Unbalanced forces make things move.\@QR\#An object will move diagonally when perpendicular forces are applied to it.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#An object will continue moving until an equal force acts upon it in the opposite direction.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#If you're free to move, throwing an object behind you can cause you to move faster in a forward direction.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\!|QT\!\!Of the principles we've learned, which principle explains why your ship started to move?\!QR\#Newton's First Law of Motion\#There you go!  Newton's First Law of Motion is all about how to get an object to stop and start moving.\@QR\#Newton's Second Law of Motion\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Newton's Third Law of Motion\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Speed = the distance you travel each second\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\!|$P|*15|6|*2|2|*0|*0|*TR:2,2;12,2|*MO;StartPortal;art/MissionObjects(StartPortal_1);StartPortal;1;2.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;EndPortal;art/MissionObjects(EndPortal_1);EndPortal;1;12.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|*|*|*|$AP|^AS;;;|$0|$1$1|$100|$1|5

M|$testMission|$Warp 1|$We want to understand what makes objects move. In the next area, help us get moving from rest. |$Navigate your ship to an open portal.|$4|0|0|0|0|0|0|$|$|$QT\!\!Great job! I have a few pilots of my own struggling to get their ships to move - what could I tell them in order to get their ships moving?\!QR\#You have to apply force in the direction you want the ship to move.\#Yes, I think that works. Applying a force started them moving.\@QR\#You have to apply force in the opposite direction you want the ship to move.\#Sorry, that didn't seem to work. The opposite forces canceled, and the ships did not move.\@QR\#You have to apply multiple forces in different directions in order to get the ship moving.\#Sorry, that didn't seem to work. The opposite forces canceled, and the ships did not move.\@QR\#Your ship already has to be moving in order to get started.\#Sorry that didn't really help us. We want to know how to move when we're standing still.\!|QT\!\!Way to go!  What is the best general rule we could add to our flight manual for what you did?\!QR\#A object that is not moving will not start moving until acted upon by an unbalanced force.\#That sounds right. Unbalanced forces make things move.\@QR\#An object will move diagonally when perpendicular forces are applied to it.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#An object will continue moving until an equal force acts upon it in the opposite direction.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#If you're free to move, throwing an object behind you can cause you to move faster in a forward direction.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\!|QT\!\!Yikes!  Now that we've got our ships moving we can't get them to stop!  Teach my pilots - how do we get our ships to stop like yours?!\!QR\#Add the same amount of force in the opposite direction as you are traveling.\#That works! An equal but opposite force made us stop.\@QR\#Add the same amount of force in the same direction as you are traveling.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. Adding more force in the same direction made us move faster.\@QR\#Apply greater force in the same direction you are traveling.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. A greater force in the same direction made our ships move faster.\@QR\#Apply greater force in the opposite direction you are traveling.\#Seems like that might not quite work. A greater opposite force made our ships move in the opposite direction instead of stopping.\!|$P|*15|6|*2|2|*0|*0|*TR:2,2;13,2|*MO;StartPortal;art/MissionObjects(StartPortal_1);StartPortal;1;2.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;EndPortal;art/MissionObjects(EndPortal_1);EndPortal;1;13.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;2.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;3.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;4.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;8.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;9.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;0.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;1.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m48_1);Rad;1;2.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;4.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;3.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m26_1);Rad;1;2.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;6.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;7.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;8.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;9.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m48_1);Rad;1;14.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;13.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;12.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m26_1);Rad;1;11.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m8_1);Rad;1;11.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionO M|$testMission|$Warp 1|$We want to understand what makes objects move. In the next area, help us get moving from rest. |$Navigate your ship to an open portal.|$8|0|0|0|0|0|0|$|$|$QT\!\!Great job! I have a few pilots of my own struggling to get their ships to move - what could I tell them in order to get their ships moving?\!QR\#You have to apply an unbalanced force in the direction you want the ship to move.\#Yes, I think that works. Applying a force started them moving.\@QR\#You have to apply an unbalanced force in the opposite direction you want the ship to move.\#Sorry, that didn't seem to work. The opposite forces canceled, and the ships did not move.\@QR\#You have to balance the forces on the ship in order to get the ship moving.\#Sorry, that didn't seem to work. The opposite forces canceled, and the ships did not move.\@QR\#Your ship already has to be moving in order to get started.\#Sorry that didn't really help us. We want to know how to move when we're standing still.\!|QT\!\!Way to go!  What is the best general rule we could add to our flight manual for what you did?\!QR\#A object that is not moving will not start moving until acted upon by an unbalanced force.\#That sounds right. Unbalanced forces make things move.\@QR\#An object will move diagonally when perpendicular forces are applied to it.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#An object will continue moving until an equal force acts upon it in the opposite direction.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\@QR\#The direction of an object's motion is a result of adding together all of the forces acting on the object.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes go.\!|QT\!\!Yikes!  Now that we've got our ships moving we can't get them to stop!  Teach my pilots - how do we get our ships to stop like yours?!\!QR\#Add an equal amount of force in the opposite direction you are traveling.\#That works! An equal but opposite force made us stop.\@QR\#Add an equal amount of force in the same direction you are traveling.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. Adding more force in the same direction made us move faster.\@QR\#Apply an unequal amount of force in the same direction you are traveling.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. A greater force in the same direction made our ships move faster.\@QR\#Apply an unequal amount of force in the opposite direction you are traveling.\#Seems like that might not quite work. A greater opposite force made our ships move in the opposite direction instead of stopping.\!|$P|*15|6|*2|2|*0|*0|*TR:2,2;13,2|*MO;StartPortal;art/MissionObjects(StartPortal_1);StartPortal;1;2.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;EndPortal;art/MissionObjects(EndPortal_1);EndPortal;1;13.00;2.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;2.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;3.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;4.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;8.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;9.00;0.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;0.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;1.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m48_1);Rad;1;2.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;4.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;3.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m26_1);Rad;1;2.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m6_1);Rad;1;6.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;7.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;8.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m4_1);Rad;1;9.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m48_1);Rad;1;14.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;13.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m46_1);Rad;1;12.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m26_1);Rad;1;11.00;4.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionObjects(Rad_m8_1);Rad;1;11.00;5.00;1.00;1.00;0.00;1.00;1;|MO;RadiationCloud;art/MissionO M|$testMission|$Warp 2|$Now we understand how to start moving, but what makes motion change once it starts? Help us figure out how to stop moving so that we can turn a corner.|$Navigate your ship to an open portal.|$5|0|0|0|0|0|0|$|$|$QT\!\!Yikes!  Now that we've got our ships moving we can't get them to stop!  Teach my pilots - how do we get our ships to stop like yours?!\!QR\#Apply a balanced force in the opposite direction of the ship's motion.\#That works! An equal but opposite force made us stop.\@QR\#Apply an unbalanced force in the direction of the ship's motion.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. Adding more force in the same direction made us move faster.\@QR\#Apply an unbalanced force in the opposite direction of the ship's motion.\#Seems like that might not quite work. A greater opposite force made our ships move in the opposite direction instead of stopping.\@QR\#Wait for the beginning force to run out.\#Seems like that might not quite work. The force never ran out.\!|QT\!\!Nice answer! What is the best general rule we could add to our flight manual for what you did?\!QR\#An object will continue moving until an equal force acts upon it in the opposite direction.\#That's what we were looking for. Motion stops because of an opposite force.\@QR\#An object will move diagonally when horizontal and vertical forces are applied to it.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes stop.\@QR\#An object that is not moving will not start moving until acted upon by a force.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes stop.\@QR\#Acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the force applied upon the object.\#That rule seems true, but not sure it fits? We want to know what makes our planes stop.\!|QT\!\!Of the principles we've learned, which principle explains how you were able to get your ship to stop?\!QR\#Newton's First Law of Motion\#There you go!  Newton's First Law of Motion is all about how to get an object to stop and start moving.\@QR\#Newton's Second Law of Motion\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Newton's Third Law of Motion\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Speed = the distance you travel each second\#That doesn't feel quite right? M|$testMission|$Warp 2|$Now we understand how to start moving, but what makes motion change once it starts? Now that we've got our ships moving we can't get them to stop!  Teach my pilots - how do we get our ships to stop like yours?!\!QR\#Apply a balanced force in the opposite direction of the ship's motion.\#That works! An equal but opposite force made us stop.\@QR\#Apply an unbalanced force in the direction of the ship's motion.\#Hmmm. Not sure if that can stop our ships. The force never ran out.\!|QT\!\!Nice answer! What is the best general rule we could add to our flight manual for what you did?\!QR\#An object will continue moving until an equal force acts upon it in the opposite direction.\#That's what we were looking for. We want to know what makes our planes stop.\!|QT\!\!Of the principles we've learned, which principle explains how you were able to get your ship to stop?\!QR\#Newton's First Law of Motion\#There you go! Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Newton's Third Law of Motion\#That doesn't feel quite right?  Which principle talks about how to get an object to stop and start moving?\@QR\#Speed = the distance you travel each second\#That doesn't feel quite right? M|$testMission|$Warp 3|$We are trying to understand the ideas you have taught us, but this area is still confusing. It looks like you have to pay attention to how the forces combine with one another at different times.|$Navigate your ship to an open portal.|$0|0|0|1|0|0|0|$|$|$QT\!\!That was some slick Fuzzy launching!  How did launching the Fuzzy affect the motion of your ship?\!QR\#My ship started to accelerate to the right as a result of the force from throwing the Fuzzy to the left.\#You nailed it!  The force of launching the Fuzzy accelerated your ship in the opposite direction.\@QR\#My ship started to accelerate along with the Fuzzy toward the same place.\#Let's think about that a little more.  Think about which direction your ship traveled and which direction the Fuzzy traveled.\@QR\#My ship didn't move at all after throwing the Fuzzy.\#Are you sure?  I thought I saw your ship move after throwing that Fuzzy!\@QR\#Throwing the Fuzzy didn't change the motion of my ship.\#Are you sure?  Something seemed to happen to your ship after throwing the Fuzzy.\!|QT\!\!Incredible!  Our flight manual definitely needs to explain that move - what should we add?\!QR\#Acceleration = the change in velocity each second\#You got it! Your acceleration is equal to how much your velocity increases each second.\@QR\#Acceleration = the change in distance each second\#Why don't we check that again.  What changes each second as you accelerate?\@QR\#Acceleration = the change in speed each meter\#Why don't we check that again.  What is changing as you accelerate?\@QR\#Acceleration = the opposite of your velocity each second\#Why don't we check that again.  Acceleration measures what?\!|QT\!\!Of the principles we've learned, which explains why you started to accelerate as your velocity increased over time?\!QR\#Acceleration = the change in velocity each second\#Way to go!  As your velocity increases over the same amount of time you accelerate.\@QR\#Newton's First Law of Motion\#Why don't we look at that again?
